bibl.title: Syncretism in Panopolis? The Evidence of the "Mary Silk" in the Abegg Stiftung.
Perspectives on Panopolis: An Egyptian Town from Alexander the Great to the Arab Conquest. Acts from an International Symposium Held in Leiden on 16, 17 and 18 December 1998
bibl.author: McNALLY, Sheila

bibl.note: Riggisberg, Abegg Stiftung. The "Mary Silk" depicts scenes from the live of the Virgin Mary. The hanging shows Dionysos with his followers (it had been wrapped around the silk, and both around a body in the grave). Panopolis, around A.D. 400.
McNALLY Sheila, Syncretism in Panopolis? The Evidence of the "Mary Silk" in the Abegg Stiftung.

A. EGBERTS, B.P. MUHS and J. VAN DER VLIET (Edd.), Perspectives on Panopolis: An Egyptian Town from Alexander the Great to the Arab Conquest. Acts from an International Symposium Held in Leiden on 16, 17 and 18 December 1998 = Papyrologica Lugduno-Batava. XXXI (Leiden, 2002) pp. 145-164, 12 figg. et pll. VI-VIII.
